required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Very Small Embryonic-like Stem Cells for Knee Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Autologous Very Small Embryonic-like Stem Cells(VSELs) for Knee Osteoarthritis

collaborator.agency: Guangzhou Four-Leaf Clover HealthTech Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is the safety and efficacy of autologous very small embryonic-like stem cells(VSELs) to knee osteoarthritis.

detailed_description.textblock: VSELs come from the patient's peripheral blood, and will be injected in the most painful knee, or the worse knee on physical examination. Then follow-up the knee pain and imaging changes at 6 months and 1 year after treatment.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Three experimental groups were injected with different doses of VSEL, and the control group was injected with platelet-containing serum that dissolved VSEL.
study_design_info.masking_description: The investigators screen patients with similar knee condition to ensure a small difference, and they randomized different numbers of VSELs to the patients.

primary_outcome.description: Pain assessment by visual analogue score (VAS). 0 point: no pain; 1-3 points: there is a slight pain that can be tolerated; 4-6 points: the patient has pain and affects sleep, and can still bear it; 7-10 points: the patient has progressively strong pain, pain is unbearable, affecting appetite and sleep

secondary_outcome.description: Pain assessment by visual analogue score (VAS). 0 point: no pain; 1-3 points: there is a slight pain that can be tolerated; 4-6 points: the patient has pain and affects sleep, and can still bear it; 7-10 points: the patient has progressively strong pain, pain is unbearable, affecting appetite and sleep

secondary_outcome.measure: Imaging changes in the knee joint
secondary_outcome.description: Magnetic resonance image (MRI) examination of the smoothness of the knee joint surface, ligament, soft tissue and meniscus damage

Pain assessment by visual analogue score (VAS). 0 point: no pain; 1-3 points: there is a slight pain that can be tolerated; 4-6 points: the patient has pain and affects sleep, and can still bear it; 7-10 points: the patient has progressively strong pain, pain is unbearable, affecting appetite and sleep

secondary_outcome.measure: Imaging changes in the knee joint
secondary_outcome.description: MRI examination of the smoothness of the knee joint surface, ligament, soft tissue and meniscus damage

arm_group.description: A mean volume of 5.5 mL platelet-rich plasma containing approximately 120,000 cells were prepared and injected into the selected knee of the patient
A mean volume of 5.5 mL platelet-rich plasma containing approximately 90,000 cells were prepared and injected into the selected knee of the patient
A mean volume of 5.5 mL platelet-rich plasma containing approximately 60,000 cells were prepared and injected into the selected knee of the patient
A mean volume of 5.5 mL platelet-rich plasma containing no VSELs injected into the selected knee of the patient

intervention.description: Mononuclear cells were collected from peripheral blood of each patient using a machine, VSELs were isolated, and each group was injected according to different numbers after activation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients had moderate to severe osteoarthritis of both knees.
- Those had mechanical pain of knee joints, which was aggravated by walking or stair climbing.
- Those complained of gelling pain of knee joint.
- Those have crepitus and limitation of the joint range of motion with joint bony hypertrophy on physical examination, X-rays showed narrowing of joint space and osteophyte formation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetic foot and patients with obvious edema in the legs caused by various causes
- Blood disease patients, thrombocytopenia or dysfunction, hypofibrinemia or anticoagulant therapy, long-term use of aspirin

facility.name: Biological treatment center in Fuda cancer hospital
